definitions.definition: To canonize, to formally recognize someone as a saint.
definitions.example: Many wish to see Pope John Paul II sainted immediately.

definitions.definition: Made a saint; saint-like, reverenced.
definitions.example: Pope John Paul II, of sainted memory, is a candidate for beatification.

definitions.definition: Used to mark a beloved person mentioned in conversation as being deceased.
definitions.example: My sainted mother never had an evening dress.

definitions.definition: Pious, saintly.
Much admired.
A long, broad and thick piece of timber, as opposed to a board which is less thick.
A political issue that is of concern to a faction or a party of the people and the political position that is taken on that issue.
definitions.example: Germanization was a central plank of German conservative thinking in the 19th and 20th centuries.

definitions.definition: Physical exercise in which one holds a pushup position for a measured length of time.
A stupid person, idiot.
That which supports or upholds.
To cover something with planking.
definitions.example: to plank a floor or a ship

definitions.definition: To bake (fish, etc.) on a piece of cedar lumber.
To lay down, as on a plank or table; to stake or pay cash.
definitions.example: to plank money in a wager

definitions.definition: To harden, as hat bodies, by felting.
To splice together the ends of slivers of wool, for subsequent drawing.
To pose for a photograph while lying rigid, face down, arms at side, in an unusual place.
An essential or indispensable element, condition, or ingredient.
Any of the several species of plant in the genus Taraxacum, characterised by yellow flower heads and notched, broad-ended leaves, especially the common dandelion (Taraxacum officinale).
The flower head or fruiting head of the dandelion plant.
A yellow colour, like that of the flower.
Of a yellow colour, like that of the flower.
A flight of stairs; a stairway.
A connected set of flights of stairs; a stairwell.
A set of locks (enclosed sections of waterway) mounted one above the next.
To modify (a signal, a graph, etc.) so as to reduce a smooth curve to a series of discrete steps.
A small mollusc, of the family Patellidae with a conical shell found clinging to rocks in the intertidal zones of rocky shores.
Someone clingy or dependent; someone disregarding or ignorant of another's personal space.
definitions.example: He stuck to me like a limpet all day!

definitions.definition: Any activity by an astronaut outside of a spacecraft or space station in space; extravehicular activity.
To perform a spacewalk.
A small hand-held explosive device designed to be thrown at an enemy.
Fire grenade (kind of portable fire extinguisher)
A person who is trained to assist a professional.
Of or relating to this assistance.
(especially used by children) A person having an inflated opinion of himself; a conceited or arrogant person.
One of several species of fish having a large head.
One of several animal diseases that cause swelling of the head.
A wide-mouthed jug, normally of glass, with graduations up the side, for measuring liquids.
Rebellion; revolt; the state of being insurgent
definitions.example: suppress the insurgency by isolating the rebels from the rest of the population

definitions.definition: Any of various small, brightly coloured parrots native to Australasia. They are usually classified in the subfamily Loriinae.
An employee or other worker with some particular function or skill.
A spy, secret agent, or detective.
A participant in an operation.
Effectual or important.
definitions.example: He's usually in a good mood — the operative word there being "usually". Today was a disaster.

definitions.definition: Functional, in working order.
Having the power of acting; hence, exerting force, physical or moral; active in the production of effects.
definitions.example: an operative motive

definitions.definition: Producing the appropriate or designed effect; efficacious.
definitions.example: an operative dose, rule, or penalty

definitions.definition: Based upon, or consisting of, a surgical operation or operations.
definitions.example: operative surgery

definitions.definition: Any thick liquid that has a high sugar content and which is added to or poured over food as a flavouring.
definitions.example: maple syrup

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any viscous liquid.
definitions.example: cough syrup

definitions.definition: (shortened from "syrup of figs") A wig.
Lack of emotion or motivation; lack of interest or enthusiasm towards something; disinterest (in something).
A professional who dispenses prescription drugs in a hospital or retail pharmacy.
(academic) One who studies pharmacy.
A building of residence for the poor, sick or elderly of a parish. Originally founded by the Church. Usually a charity relying on donations for funding.
The inability of a household to keep adequately warm at a reasonable cost.
To bring down by cutting.
definitions.example: They want to cut down several trees to make room for the parking lot.

definitions.definition: To insult, to belittle.
To reduce the amount of something.
definitions.example: He wants to cut down on extra steps.

definitions.definition: To slay, often in great numbers.
An alluvial plain that may or may not experience occasional or periodic flooding.
To separate the grain from the straw or husks (chaff) by mechanical beating, with a flail or machinery.
To beat soundly, usually with some tool such as a stick or whip; to drub.
To believe or assert on uncertain grounds.
The process or act of reuniting.
definitions.example: It was a tearful and heartfelt reunion as the trapped miners finally saw their dear loved ones again.

definitions.definition: A planned event at which members of a dispersed group meet together.
definitions.example: Are you going to the reunion this year?

definitions.definition: First-degree. Compare second-degree, third-degree and fourth-degree.
A manager with overall responsibility for an organisation or a distinct unit of an organisation.
Initialism of group message.
Something seen as inferior.
Sheet glass; a type of glass, initially produced in plane form, commonly used for windows, windshields, etc.
A precious stone, usually of substantial monetary value or prized for its beauty or shine.
Any precious or highly valued thing or person.
definitions.example: She's an absolute gem.

definitions.definition: Anything of small size, or expressed within brief limits, which is regarded as a gem on account of its beauty or value, such as a small picture, a verse of poetry, or an epigram.
definitions.example: a gem of wit

definitions.definition: A gemma or leaf-bud.
A type of geometrid moth, Orthonama obstipata.
A package containing programs or libraries for the Ruby programming language.
A size of type between brilliant (4-point) and diamond (4½-point), running 222 lines to the foot.
To adorn with, or as if with, gems.
(manner) In a positive manner.
definitions.example: He approached the interview positively.

definitions.definition: (modal) With certainty.
definitions.example: I will positively be there at 8 a.m.

definitions.definition: (degree) Very.
definitions.example: I had a positively wonderful time.

definitions.definition: Used to suggest or state tentatively that something may be the case (often the opposite of something previously implied).
definitions.example: The situation is, if anything, worsening rather than improving.

definitions.definition: Used in questions when the speaker does not know for sure if the listener will have an answer.
definitions.example: What can you tell me, if anything, about this book?

definitions.definition: A tendril.
A thin tendril-like appendage.
A principal high-level cloud type characterised by white, delicate filaments or wisps, of white (or mostly white) patches, or of narrow bands, found at an altitude of above 7000 metres.
A rifle that propels a pellet or other projectile by using compressed gas, rather than an explosion of gunpowder or other means.
A small nonmilitary, non-nuclear submarine for exploration.
A retroactive term used for non-nuclear submarines; nuclear submarines are termed "true submarines".

A term used primarily by some navies for nuclear submarines, termed "true submersibles", because they cannot retroactively declare that their non-nuclear submarines should be called by a different name.
A very small "baby" submarine designed for specific localized missions, usually while tethered to a submarine or ship for life support and communications. Slang synonyms: midget-submarine, anchor.
Able to be submerged.
A branch of biology that deals with the functions and activities of life or of living matter (as organs, tissues, or cells) and of the physical and chemical phenomena involved.
The study and description of natural objects; natural science.
A therapist who treats physical injury or dysfunction, usually with exercise.
Therapy that uses physical techniques such as massage, ultrasound, heat, and exercise
A baby born using in vitro fertilisation
(of a stimulus) Below the threshold of conscious perception, especially if still able to produce a response.
To remove.
To escort someone on a date.
definitions.example: Let me take you out for dinner.

definitions.definition: To immobilize with force; to subdue; to incapacitate.
To kill or destroy.
definitions.example: The soldiers were instructed to take out the enemy base by any means necessary.

definitions.definition: To win a sporting event, competition, premiership, etc.
To obtain by application by a legal or other official process.
definitions.example: take out a loan;  take out medical insurance;  take out a membership;  take out a patent

definitions.definition: A decision that is not unanimous made by a panel of decision-makers, such as an appellate court.
(competitive fighting) an outcome in several full-contact combat sports where two of the three judges score for the same fighter as the winner, while the third judge scores for the other fighter.
A prediction, especially one made by a prophet or under divine inspiration.
definitions.example: French writer Nostradamus made a prophecy in his book.

definitions.definition: The public interpretation of Scripture.
To speak or write with divine inspiration; to act as prophet.
To predict, to foretell (with or without divine inspiration).
To foreshow; to herald; to prefigure.
To speak out on the Bible as an expression of holy inspiration; to preach.
The act, or the sport, of skating on ice.
Any of a class of mental disorders characterized by ongoing rigid patterns of thought and action.
A headband
A hair tie
Thought, imagination, or conjecture, which may be based upon feeble or scanty evidence; suspicion; guess.
definitions.example: surmises of jealousy or of envy

definitions.definition: Reflection; thought; posit.
To imagine or suspect; to conjecture; to posit with contestable premises.
An ailment; trouble; illness.
To cause to suffer; to trouble, afflict. (Now chiefly in interrogative or indefinite constructions.)
definitions.example: Have some chicken soup. It's good for what ails you.

definitions.definition: To be ill; to suffer; to be troubled.
Painful; troublesome.
The awn of barley or other types of corn.
Fearful; afraid; timid
To make angry
To stir or move from a state of calm or order
definitions.example: It riles me that she never closes the door after she leaves.

definitions.definition: A building which contains lanes for bowling.
A place where ships are built and repaired.
Of, from, or pertaining to Antarctica and the south polar regions.
Opposite, contradictory.
Southern.
A young horse or related animal, especially just after birth or less than a year old.
A young boy who assisted the headsman by pushing or pulling the tub.
To give birth to (a foal); to bear offspring.
A minced, cooked food (usually meat or vegetables), which is deep-fried in fat and sometimes sprinkled with breadcrumbs.
(chiefly in the plural) The water of a flood.
One who expounds, represents or advocates.
The number by which a value (called the base) is said to be raised to a power in exponentiation: for example, the 3 in 2^3=8.
The degree to which the root of a radicand is found, for example, the 2 in \sqrt[2]r=b.
A manifestation of a morphosyntactic property.
The part of a floating-point number that represents its exponent value.
A Southern US dish of tenderized cube steak coated with seasoned flour and pan-fried.
A type of house which shares both sidewalls with the adjacent houses, typical of Victorian and Edwardian housing in English cities.
The stages of film (or audio) production happening between the actual filming (or recording) and the completed product.
A horizontal airfoil, at the rear of an aircraft, to which the elevator is attached; usually associated with the tailfin
Affected by gas in the intestine; likely to fart.
Empty; vain.
Punishment inflicted in the spirit of moral outrage or personal vengeance.
Something that is given away or handed out for free.
definitions.example: The T-shirt was a giveaway from the company that sells the software.

definitions.definition: An event at which things are given away for free.
Something that is obvious or apparent; something that reveals a secret.
definitions.example: The frosting in his beard was a giveaway that he had been munching the cake.

definitions.definition: A severe psychiatric condition, often associated with schizophrenia, characterized by a tendency to remain in a rigid state of stupor for long periods which give way to short periods of extreme agitation.
A frozen, unresponsive state, as of electronic equipment.

A person who flees or escapes and travels secretly from place to place, and sometimes using disguises and aliases to conceal his/her identity, as to avoid law authorities in order to avoid an arrest or prosecution; or to avoid some other unwanted situation.
Fleeing or running away
Transient, fleeting or ephemeral
Elusive or difficult to retain
An examination taken a second time.
To take an examination a second time.
To weaken; to affect negatively; to have a diminishing effect on.
To grow worse; to deteriorate.
A criminal charge for driving a vehicle while impaired.
definitions.example: The cop gave me an impaired.

definitions.definition: Rendered less effective.
definitions.example: His impaired driving skill due to alcohol caused the accident.

definitions.definition: Inebriated, drunk.
To botch up, bumble or incompetently perform a task; to make or mend clumsily; to manage awkwardly.
An act of incompetence or ineptitude.
definitions.example: Your bungling nearly cost us our jobs.

definitions.definition: Incompetent or inept.
definitions.example: Harry made a bungling attempt to catch the ball.

definitions.definition: One who teases or pokes fun.
(textile treatment) A person or thing that teases.
A preview or part of a product released in preparation of its main advertising, typically a short film, song or quote.
A kind of gull, the jaeger.
A shunt winding on field magnets for maintaining their magnetism when the main circuit is open.
The stoker of a glassworks furnace.
A short horizontal curtain used to mask the flies and frame the top of the inner stage opening, adjustable to the desired height.
The owner of a Scottish estate; a member of the landed gentry, a landowner.
Often in the form Laird of, followed by a patronymic: a Scottish clan chief.
Chiefly as laird it over: to behave like a laird, particularly to act haughtily or to domineer; to lord (it over).
A colloquy; a meeting for discussion.
An academic meeting or seminar usually led by a different lecturer and on a different topic at each meeting.
An address to an academic meeting or seminar.
That part of the complaint or declaration in an action for defamation which shows that the words complained of were spoken concerning the plaintiff.
Something that is tough, or difficult.
definitions.example: His question is a toughie. I might have to do some more research.

definitions.definition: Any of the three small bats of the subfamily Desmodontinae, native to South America, which use their teeth to nick larger animals while they are asleep, allowing it to surreptitiously lap a blood meal.
A period of very hot weather.
An at-grade crossing between a railroad line and an ordinary road, with tracks and road at the same level.
A writing board finished with a hard white material, which can be written upon using special non-permanent markers and subsequently wiped clean.
(by extension) A collaborative tool allowing several users to write and draw on the same shared display.
A cutting tool similar to scissors, but often larger.
The act of shearing, or something removed by shearing.
Forces that push in opposite directions.
A transformation that displaces every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
The response of a rock to deformation usually by compressive stress, resulting in particular textures.
To cut, originally with a sword or other bladed weapon, now usually with shears, or as if using shears.
To remove the fleece from a sheep etc by clipping.
To deform because of forces pushing in opposite directions.
To transform by displacing every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
To make a vertical cut in the coal.
To reap, as grain.
To deprive of property; to fleece.
A row of toll booths on a toll road or turnpike
